titles.title: Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-365, by Mr. Sessions.
Resolution providing for motions to suspend the rules.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 128.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 354.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 191 (Roll no. 49).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/5/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Makes it in order at any time on March 6, 2002, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules relating to the following measures: (1) S.J. Res. 32 (the U.S. Military Academy at West Point's bicentennial anniversary); (2) S. 1857 (encouraging the negotiated settlement of tribal claims); (3) H.R. 1870 (Fallon (Nevada) Rail Freight Loading Facility transfer); (4) H.R. 1883 (Oregon Burnt, Malheur, Owyhee, and Powder River Basins water optimization feasibility study); (5) H.R. 1963 (designation of the George Rogers Clark Northwest Campaign Trail in Illinois and Indiana for study for potential addition to the National Trails System); (6) a bill to provide assistance to displaced workers by extending unemployment benefits and by providing a credit for health insurance costs; and (7) a resolution expressing support for the democratically elected government of Colombia and its efforts to counter threats from U.S.-designated foreign terrorist organizations.
